Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as there is no evidence or historical data provided to back up the claim that Halloween falling on Friday the 13th in 2018 is the first time in 666 years.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Halloween has been observed on October 13 in the past, which is a problematic assumption as there is no historical evidence to support this.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Halloween in 2018 falls on Wednesday, October 31, not on Friday the 13th.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the provided claim.
Exaggerate: There is no exaggeration bias present in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by incorrectly stating that Halloween will fall on Friday the 13th in 2018.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide an alternative explanation.
